Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, fabric is black in section, with five lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.170)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36377) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36377)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 234 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13423 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
